<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
PrintWriter out = response.getWriter();
CharResponseWrapper wrappedResponse = new CharResponseWrapper((HttpServletResponse)response);
chain.doFilter(wrappedRequest, wrappedResponse);
String s = wrappedResponse.toString();
if (wrappedResponse.getContentType().equals("text/html") && StringUtils.isNotBlank(s)) {
    int index = s.lastIndexOf("</body>");
    if (index != -1) {
        s = new StringBuilder(s).insert(index, "Your HTML chunk").toString();
    }
    response.setContentLength(s.length());
    out.write(s);
} else {
    out.write(wrappedResponse.toString());
}
out.close();
<<<explanation>>>: The code above uses a CharResponseWrapper to capture the response. It then checks if the content type of the response is "text/html" and if the response is not blank. If these conditions are met, it finds the index of the "</body>" tag in the response string. If the "</body>" tag is found, it inserts the HTML chunk at that index. The content length of the response is then updated to reflect the new length of the response string. Finally, the modified response string is written to the PrintWriter. If the conditions are not met, the original response string is written to the PrintWriter.
